Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a large red/brown pottery vessel of flaring form, the fabric is black in section, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and with remains of at least nineteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, now smudged and faded, containing a probable account of vegetables.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.124-125)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36331) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36331)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 147 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13377 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
